body:
Comment 6: 
Hi Ronny.  Sorry for the long delay, but are you still seeing this problem
in recent releases?  If so, you can get a stack trace by running 
one of the broken program by hand.  For example:

cd $GOROOT/test/chan
6g nonblock.go
6l nonblock.6
./6.out
./6.out
./6.out
...

It feels like you are up against some kind of memory
corruption, but it is very weird that no one else is seeing this.
_Owner changed to **r...@golang.org**._
